column4: I did a apt-get upgrade and dist-upgrade last night on my home desktop and now I cannot use it. After entering the username and password, I get a black screen with my mouse pointer and it never changes. I looked at dmesg but didn't notice anything obvious and I tried dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg but still no luck. What else can I do?

I did a apt-get upgrade and dist-upgrade last night on my home desktop and now I cannot use it. After entering the username and password, I get a black screen with my mouse pointer and it never changes. I looked at dmesg but didn't notice anything obvious and I tried dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg but still no luck. What else can I do?
sorry
didn't mean to do that twice
does alt+f2 work?
yes
run nautilus ;)
nautilus draws the desktop, so its probably not started
I will try that when I get home later.  I am using kde mostly, but did install gnome
the app is ready but the deps have not being made yet
so you will get updates held back until they are ready
Oh, thanks.  I thought maybe I had something installed that I shouldnt have
The updates are for Linux-headers-generic-2.6.28.15.20(amd64) same for restricted-modules, generic and image-generic  is this normal?
you can run: sudo apt-get install limux-image-2.6.28.15.20     if you really NEED the kernel. If your system is fine then you dont need it
so it will be "unblocked" when the deps are finished?
yeah, when its ready it will come down
cool, thanks for the info
I am currently running 64Bit on a core 2 duo 2.54  am I "really" benefiting by using 64 bit or is there not really much diff from 32 bit?
how much ram do you have?
apps like audio and video encoding / decoding benefit from 64bit
you NEED 64bit as you have more than 3Gb RAM
thanks for that
max for 32bit + PAE is about 6Gb ram (i think) max for 64bit is 4 exabtytes
